name: nonprofessional
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a person) doing something as a hobby or to help someone, not as a paid job: The director liked to use nonprofessional actors in her films. Most people who play the game are nonprofessional.
(of work) not needing special training or education: Many graduates work in nonprofessional jobs for a while after leaving university. He advised me not to take on a non-professional job.
having the type of job that does not involve a high level of education and training: A teacher can earn a lot more than most nonprofessional workers. Most of our students come from non-professional families.
More examplesFewer examplesThe children often serve as non-professional translators for their parents.A non-professional choir like ours relies on the dedication and commitment of volunteer singers.We recruited 50 nonprofessional taste testers to help us.There is a huge difference between professional and non-professional sport.
